abstract: The former Galleon head gets the toughest sentence yet for insider trading.
snippet: The former Galleon head gets the toughest sentence yet for insider trading.
lead_paragraph: Raj Rajaratnam, the Galleon Group chief at the center of the United States' massive insider trading investigation, was sentenced to eleven years in prison. His sentence is the longest ever for insider-trading in the United States, and follows a ten-year term for Zvi Goffer, a hedge fund manager at Galleon.
